channel.title: 2025-11 on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in 2025-11 on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: dotnet: .NET Day on Agentic Modernization Coming Soon
item.description:
A live event on December 9 will showcase practical approaches to modernize .NET applications using Azure, AI, and agentic tooling. The announcement was posted on the .NET Blog.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: k8s: Kubernetes v1.35 Sneak Peek
item.description:
Kubernetes v1.35 (planned 2025-12-17) introduces several deprecations and new/advanced features. Major removals/deprecations include cgroup v1 support removal, deprecation of kube-proxy ipvs mode, and final support for containerd v1.x (users must move to containerd 2.0+). Notable enhancements likely in v1.35 include node declared features (alpha), in-place Pod resource updates (GA), pod certificates (beta), numeric taint comparisons, continued progress on user namespaces, and image volumes becoming default.

  • Source: Kubernetes Official Blog

item.title: github: Copilot agent sessions from external apps are now available on GitHub Mobile for Android
item.description:
GitHub Mobile for Android adds a new Android sharesheet custom action that lets you share content from other apps to start Copilot agent sessions directly in the mobile app.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Secret scanning alert assignees, security campaigns are generally available
item.description:
GitHub announced that secret scanning alert assignees and security campaigns are now generally available. Alert assignees will receive email notifications to help teams track and remediate secret scanning alerts more effectively.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Secrets in unlisted GitHub gists are reported to secret scanning partners
item.description:
As of 2025-11-25, GitHub will report publicly leaked secrets found in unlisted gists to the appropriate secret scanning partners, extending secret-scanning reporting beyond only listed/public gists.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: Charting the future of SOC: Human and AI collaboration for better security
item.description:
Microsoft describes its experience building autonomous AI agents for managed detection and response (MDR) and argues that GenAI-powered security operations centers (SOCs) will reshape how humans and AI collaborate to improve detection, investigation, and response.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Managed Identity support in Network Watcher VNET flow log, traffic analytics and packet capture
item.description:
Azure Network Watcher now has public preview support for using Managed Identities with VNET flow logs, Traffic Analytics, and packet capture, enabling identity-based authentication to store and analyze network traffic data without relying on storage account keys.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Code scanning default setup bypasses GitHub Actions policy blocks
item.description:
GitHub changed code scanning’s default setup so it will run even when an organization enforces restrictive GitHub Actions policies that normally prevent certain workflows from running. Previously those policies could block the code scanning default setup.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Custom labels configuration option for Dependabot self-hosted and larger GitHub-hosted Actions runners now generally available at the organization level
item.description:
Dependabot update jobs can now target specific self-hosted and larger GitHub-hosted Actions runners by using custom labels. The feature, previously limited to a single dependabot label, is now generally available at the organization level and provides finer control over where Dependabot runs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Custom labels configuration option for Dependabot self-hosted and larger GitHub-hosted Actions runners now generally available at the organization level
item.description:
Dependabot update jobs can now target specific self-hosted and larger GitHub-hosted Actions runners by using custom labels. The feature, previously limited to a single dependabot label, is now generally available at the organization level and provides finer control over where Dependabot runs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: ai: Introducing Memory in Foundry Agent Service
item.description:
Microsoft’s Foundry Agent Service introduces a memory capability so conversational agents can retain context across interactions rather than being stateless. This aims to prevent agents from repeating questions and removes the need for developers to build custom memory solutions using embeddings and external databases.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Introducing Multi-Agent Workflows in Foundry Agent Service
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry introduces Multi-Agent Workflows in the Foundry Agent Service to help organizations move beyond single-purpose agents toward orchestrated, multi-step, role-based AI processes that include stronger governance and operational dependability for enterprise use.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Translation Customization, A Developer‚Äôs Guide to Adaptive Custom Translation
item.description:
This Microsoft Foundry Blog post, “Translation Customization, A Developer‚Äôs Guide to Adaptive Custom Translation,” argues that translation is more than word-for-word conversion and is essential for global business communication. It highlights the need for accuracy, speed, and domain-specific terminology ‚Äî noting that 70% of consumers prefer content in their native language ‚Äî and frames a developer-focused guide for implementing adaptive custom translation to enable real-time, high-quality multilingual experiences.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Azure Content Understanding is now generally available
item.description:
Microsoft announced that Azure Content Understanding in Foundry Tools is now generally available. The GA follows preview usage across multiple industries and incorporates customer feedback; the release emphasizes flexibility and control with models.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: devops+ai: üî•Building Audit Logging for Multi-Platform AI Bots with Python, AWS Cloudwatchüî•
item.description:
This article explains how to build audit logging for multi-platform AI bots using Python and AWS CloudWatch to answer questions like ‚Äúwho is actually using our bots today?‚Äù. It covers architecture, event schema, ingestion, storage, querying, privacy considerations, and practical implementation tips to capture, ship, and analyze bot usage across channels.

  • Source: Let’s do DevOps

item.title: k8s: Kubernetes Configuration Good Practices
item.description:
This article collects practical Kubernetes configuration best practices: prefer current stable APIs, keep manifests minimal and version-controlled, write YAML carefully (watch boolean values), group related objects, favor controllers (Deployments/Jobs) over naked Pods, use Services and DNS properly, avoid hostNetwork/hostPort unless necessary, apply semantic/common labels, add helpful annotations, and use kubectl features like applying directories, label selectors and server-side apply to simplify management.

  • Source: Kubernetes Official Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Claude Opus 4.5 Available in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Claude Opus 4.5 is available in public preview on Microsoft Foundry for Azure customers, introducing improvements in coding, agentic workflows, and enterprise productivity with upgraded performance and versatility.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Claude Opus 4.5 is in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Anthropic‚Äôs Claude Opus 4.5 is now rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot; early tests show it outperforms internal coding benchmarks while cutting token usage roughly in half.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure File Sync in New Zealand North
item.description:
Azure File Sync is now generally available in the New Zealand North region, enabling customers to tier data from on-premises Windows Servers to Azure Files for hybrid scenarios and simplified migration while preserving on-premises file server performance and compatibility.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Entra ID support for RDP connections
item.description:
Azure Bastion now supports Microsoft Entra ID authentication for RDP connections to Windows VMs directly in the Azure portal (public preview). This allows users to authenticate with their Entra ID identity instead of using local VM credentials.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Load Testing in Italy North
item.description:
Azure Load Testing (part of Azure App Testing) is now generally available in the Italy North region, allowing customers there to run high-scale load tests and simulations to find performance bottlenecks.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure MCP Server for Azure Database for MySQL
item.description:
Azure MCP Server is now generally available with support for Azure Database for MySQL, allowing AI agents and applications to interact with MySQL data using natural language via the open Model Context Protocol (MCP).

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Regex support in T-SQL
item.description:
Microsoft announced general availability of native regular expression (regex) support in T-SQL. The feature is available in Azure SQL and SQL Server 2025, enabling advanced pattern matching directly in queries to simplify code, improve maintainability, and reduce external dependencies.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Custom handler support in Azure Functions Flex consumption
item.description:
Azure Functions now has generally available support for custom handlers on the Flex consumption plan, enabling lightweight HTTP-based handlers written in any language to receive events from the Functions host.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: Retirement: Migrate to dedicated VM for your compute clusters
item.description:
Azure is retiring Low-Priority VMs on September 30, 2025. Azure Machine Learning will continue supporting them until March 31, 2026, and customers are advised to migrate their compute clusters to dedicated VMs to prevent automatic scale-down and service disruption.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: Microsoft named a Leader in the Gartner¬Æ Magic Quadrant‚Ñ¢ for Access Management for the ninth consecutive year
item.description:
Microsoft was named a Leader in the 2025 Gartner¬Æ Magic Quadrant‚Ñ¢ for Access Management, marking the ninth consecutive year the company has received this recognition.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: Pull request ‚ÄúFiles changed‚Äù public preview ‚Äì November 20 updates
item.description:
GitHub announced a public preview (Nov 20) that lets you view the pull request description directly on the new ‚ÄúFiles changed‚Äù page so reviewers don‚Äôt need to scroll, switch tabs, or lose context.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Actions cache size can now exceed 10 GB per repository
item.description:
GitHub expanded GitHub Actions cache storage so repository cache size can now exceed 10 GB, allowing projects to retain more build dependencies between workflow runs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Container network metrics filtering in Advanced Container Networking Services for (ACNS) for AKS
item.description:
Azure’s Advanced Container Networking Services (ACNS) for AKS now offers container network metrics filtering in public preview. The feature lets customers reduce ingestion of unnecessary network telemetry from containers to lower storage costs and declutter monitoring dashboards by controlling which network metrics are collected.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Linter integration with Copilot code review now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Code Review now integrates linter feedback directly into code reviews and lets repositories specify which linters to use via repository rulesets. The feature is available in public preview so teams can start surfacing and customizing actionable linter suggestions within reviews.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: MCP support for AI toolchain operator add-on in AKS
item.description:
Microsoft announced General Availability of MCP support for the AI Toolchain Operator add-on in AKS. The add-on now supports KAITO inference workspaces with integrated tool calling and Model Context Protocol (MCP), helping address challenges related to dynamic model/context handling in inference workflows.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Cluster-wide Cilium network policy with Azure CNI powered by Cilium for AKS
item.description:
Azure announced General Availability of cluster-wide Cilium network policy for AKS clusters using Azure CNI powered by Cilium. The feature enables consistent, cluster-scoped network policy enforcement across Kubernetes namespaces, addressing a common challenge for platform teams and multi-tenant environments.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Local redirect policy in Azure CNI powered by Cilium for AKS
item.description:
Azure CNI powered by Cilium for AKS now generally available: the local redirect policy reduces cross-node traffic routing to improve latency and performance for high-scale AKS workloads.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure NetApp Files single file restore from backup
item.description:
Azure NetApp Files now generally available: single file restore from backups lets you recover individual files from an Azure NetApp Files backup vault without restoring the entire volume, reducing time and cost.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Layer 7 policy with Advanced Container Networking Services (ACNS) for AKS
item.description:
Azure Container Networking Services (ACNS) for AKS announces general availability of Layer 7 Policy, enabling customers to enforce fine‚Äëgrained application‚Äëlayer traffic control in microservices architectures.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: Reinventing how .NET Builds and Ships (Again)
item.description:
The article describes how the .NET team replaced a complex distributed build system with a Unified Build approach. This change significantly simplified the build pipeline, cut build times, and made shipping .NET releases more flexible and predictable.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: DNS security policy Threat Intelligence feed
item.description:
Azure DNS security policy Threat Intelligence feed is now generally available. It provides a Microsoft-managed threat intelligence feed to protect DNS queries by identifying and blocking known malicious domains, helping prevent attacks that begin with DNS resolution.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: ai: Foundry Local comes to Android‚Äîplus on-device speech, on-prem support, and a simpler SDK
item.description:
Microsoft announces Foundry Local for Android, a preview that lets developers run AI models directly on Android devices without cloud round trips. The release also introduces on-device speech capabilities, on-premises deployment options, and a simplified SDK to make integrating local AI into mobile apps easier. A gated preview signup is available.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: How to debug and optimize RAG agents in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
This tutorial shows how to evaluate and optimize retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) agents in Microsoft Foundry using Foundry Observability. It recommends running end-to-end, reference-free RAG triad evaluators (Groundedness and Relevance) and applying advanced search and retrieval tuning before deployment.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Introducing GPT-4o Audio Models in Microsoft Foundry: A Practical Guide for Developers
item.description:
A practical developer guide from Microsoft Foundry showing how to start using Azure OpenAI’s next-generation GPT-4o audio models to build transcription and text-to-speech applications. The post explains the capabilities of the audio models, required setup in Azure/OpenAI and Foundry, best practices for integration, and considerations for testing, deployment, and costs.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Announcing Azure Language in Foundry Tools for deterministic, privacy-first agents
item.description:
Microsoft announced the integration of Azure Language into Foundry Tools to support building enterprise-grade agents that emphasize deterministic behavior and stronger privacy protections. The update is positioned to help teams create predictable, secure agentic applications with tighter integration across their AI stack.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Sphere OS version 25.10 is now available
item.description:
Azure Sphere OS version 25.10 is now generally available in the Retail feed. The release contains OS-only updates (no SDK update), and internet-connected devices will receive the update automatically from the cloud.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: ai: Assess Agentic Risks with the AI Red Teaming Agent in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry now offers major public-preview enhancements for models and agentic AI pipelines, including an AI Red Teaming Agent that helps organizations proactively identify and mitigate safety and security risks in models and agentic systems before they enter production.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: github: Enterprise bring your own key (BYOK) for GitHub Copilot is now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Enterprise Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) for GitHub Copilot is now in public preview. The feature responds to enterprise demand for greater flexibility, enabling teams that already use specific LLM providers or custom models to integrate those workflows with Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Trusted Launch is now supported for Arm64 Marketplace Images
item.description:
Azure Marketplace now offers Arm64 images that support Trusted Launch, enabling customers to run Arm64 virtual machines with Trusted Launch security features. This combines Arm64 cost and performance efficiencies with the integrity and protection benefits of Trusted Launch.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files cache volumes
item.description:
Azure NetApp Files cache volumes are now available in public preview. The feature, built on NetApp‚Äôs ONTAP FlexCache technology, provides a persistent, high-performance cache in Azure for data stored on ONTAP-based storage.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files migration assistant (portal support)
item.description:
Azure NetApp Files migration assistant is in public preview with Azure portal support. It uses ONTAP SnapMirror replication to provide an efficient, cost‚Äëeffective, and seamless way to move data from on‚Äëpremises or CVO/other cloud providers into Azure NetApp Files (ANF).

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Monitor for Azure Arc-enabled Kubernetes with OpenShift and Azure Red Hat OpenShift
item.description:
Azure Monitor is available in public preview for Azure Arc-enabled Kubernetes clusters running OpenShift and Azure Red Hat OpenShift. It provides a complete set of monitoring services to track the health and performance of Kubernetes infrastructure layers and the applications that depend on them.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: 20 MB/s/TiB Performance Tier for Azure Managed Lustre
item.description:
Azure Managed Lustre is in public preview with a new 20 MB/s/TiB performance tier that targets large-scale AI and HPC workloads and lets customers provision file systems up to 25 PiB in size.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Managed Lustre Support for Azure MCP Server
item.description:
Azure Managed Lustre is now generally available with full integration into Azure MCP Server, allowing developers and infrastructure teams to manage Managed Lustre file systems through Azure MCP Server management workflows.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: CSI Dynamic Provisioning for Azure Managed Lustre
item.description:
Azure announces general availability of CSI Dynamic Provisioning for Azure Managed Lustre (AMLFS), allowing Kubernetes workloads to request AMLFS-backed persistent volumes on demand using standard StorageClass and PersistentVolumeClaim objects.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Auto-import for Azure Managed Lustre
item.description:
Azure has released Auto-import for Azure Managed Lustre (AMLFS) in public preview, a policy-driven feature that synchronizes data from Azure Blob Storage containers into AMLFS clusters, automatically reflecting new and changed objects.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: CodeQL 2.23.5 adds support for Swift 6.2, new Java queries, and improved analysis accuracy
item.description:
GitHub released CodeQL 2.23.5, the static analysis engine used by GitHub code scanning. This update adds support for Swift 6.2, introduces three new Java security queries, and improves analysis accuracy.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Supercharge Your Test Coverage with GitHub Copilot Testing for .NET
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Testing for .NET is now available in Visual Studio, allowing developers to automatically generate, build, and run high-quality unit tests across files, projects, or entire solutions to boost test coverage and speed up the testing workflow.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Recommended alerts for Azure Monitor Workspace
item.description:
Azure Monitor is in public preview with one-click enablement of recommended alerts in the Azure portal for Azure Monitor Managed Service for Prometheus customers. These alerts monitor Azure Monitor Workspace ingestion limits to help prevent metric ingestion issues.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Managed Redis integration with Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Azure Managed Redis is now available in the Microsoft Foundry MCP tools catalog as a Public Preview, enabling customers to use Redis as a knowledge or memory store for Foundry-based AI agents and simplifying the connection between Redis and those agents.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure API Management adds support for A2A Agent APIs
item.description:
Azure API Management now publicly previews support for A2A (agent) APIs. This enables organizations to manage and govern agent APIs alongside AI model APIs, Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools, and traditional APIs.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Databricks Genie in Copilot Studio
item.description:
Microsoft has announced the public preview of Azure Databricks Genie in Copilot Studio, providing direct access to intelligent, enterprise-grade AI answers across the full Azure Databricks data estate and enabling conversational analytics.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Microsoft Foundry data connection for Azure Databricks
item.description:
Azure Databricks Genie is now integrated with Microsoft Foundry and available in public preview, enabling Genie spaces to connect directly to Foundry agents via the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to give seamless access to trusted data for building intelligent solutions.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: TLS and TCP termination on Azure Application Gateway
item.description:
Azure Application Gateway is generally available with support for TLS and TCP termination, enabling load balancing and secure processing of non-HTTP(S) traffic.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Claude in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft announced that Anthropic’s Claude models are generally available in Microsoft Foundry, giving enterprises access to Claude Sonnet 4.5, Opus 4.1, and Haiku 4.5 for advanced long-context reasoning, coding, and multimodal capabilities within Foundry’s unified frontier AI ecosystem.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: New models, enhanced code search, and better image support
item.description:
GitHub announced updates to Copilot CLI that add support for the latest AI models, improve code search capabilities, provide better image handling, and include reliability and performance enhancements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Copilot agents - a closer look at the deployment agent
item.description:
Azure has published a public preview update for Azure Copilot agents that spotlights the deployment agent. The deployment agent ‚Äî one of six new agent types ‚Äî is designed to help teams discover, plan, and deploy cloud workloads faster and with greater confidence by providing guided workflows, automation, and integration with Azure deployment patterns.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: A step-by-step guide to modernizing .NET applications with GitHub Copilot agent mode
item.description:
This .NET Blog post shows a step-by-step workflow using Visual Studio 2026 and GitHub Copilot agent mode to modernize .NET applications by upgrading .NET versions and frameworks, resolving build issues, and migrating apps to Azure with reduced manual effort.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: Azure HorizonDB
item.description:
Azure HorizonDB for PostgreSQL is a new managed PostgreSQL offering now in private preview that emphasizes high performance, large autoscaling storage (up to 128 TB), and rapid compute scalability (up to 3,072 vCores), claiming up to 3√ó faster performance than open-source PostgreSQL.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Managed Instance on Azure App Service
item.description:
Azure announces Managed Instance on Azure App Service in Public Preview, a capability that simplifies lift-and-shift migrations of web apps (especially .NET) from on-premises or VMs to the cloud with minimal configuration and no code rewrites.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Microsoft Defender for Cloud + GitHub Advanced Security
item.description:
Microsoft announced a public preview integration of Microsoft Defender for Cloud with GitHub Advanced Security to protect cloud-native applications across the full application lifecycle ‚Äî from code to cloud ‚Äî and to unify developers and security teams in a single workflow.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Smart Tier account level tiering (Azure Blob Storage and ADLS)
item.description:
Microsoft announced the public preview of Smart Tier, an account-level, fully managed and automated data tiering solution for Azure Blob Storage and Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS) that removes the need for manual tiering.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Private Marketplace for VS Code
item.description:
The VS Code Private Marketplace is now generally available. It provides a secure, enterprise-ready solution to host and manage VS Code extensions internally, fully integrated with VS Code and designed for teams that need control over deployment and updates.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Auto model selection for Copilot in JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now offers an Auto model selection option in Copilot Chat for JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse. Selecting Auto lets Copilot choose the most appropriate model for you; the feature is available in public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enhanced MCP OAuth support for GitHub Copilot in JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode
item.description:
GitHub Copilot plugins for JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode now include enhanced authentication capabilities that expand support for third‚Äëparty OAuth providers using a secure, flexible approach based on Dynamic Client Registration (DCR).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Custom agents available in GitHub Copilot for JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now offers custom agents in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, Eclipse, and Xcode. These agents let teams package reusable expertise, enforce guardrails, and grant tool access so AI behavior can be tailored to specific projects and workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Unified code-to-cloud artifact risk visibility with Microsoft Defender for Cloud now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced a public preview integration with Microsoft Defender for Cloud that provides unified risk visibility across code, build artifacts, and production context so teams can track, prioritize, and remediate the security risks that matter.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Isolated Subagents for JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that isolated subagents are now in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, Eclipse, and Xcode. These subagents, powered by isolated context, let developers delegate focused tasks to autonomous agents. The announcement appeared on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot Next Edit Suggestions (NES) now in public preview for Xcode and Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot Next Edit Suggestions (NES) is now in public preview for Xcode and Eclipse. The feature offers next-logical-edit suggestions to help developers move faster, and the announcement appears on the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot coding agent for Eclipse now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot coding agent is now available in public preview for Eclipse, bringing Copilot directly into native Eclipse workflows and adding features such as the ability to delegate tasks from within the IDE.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Plan mode in GitHub Copilot now in public preview in JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode
item.description:
GitHub Copilot‚Äôs Plan mode is now available in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, Eclipse, and Xcode, announced on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: Azure Boost confidential device
item.description:
Azure Boost confidential device is entering a private preview. Azure Boost offloads virtualization tasks such as networking, storage, and host management from the hypervisor and host OS to purpose-built hardware and software.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: Azure Boost remote storage throughput and network bandwidth enhancements
item.description:
Microsoft has opened a private preview for performance enhancements in the latest Azure Boost architecture that improve remote storage throughput and network bandwidth. Azure Boost offloads virtualization functions (networking, storage, host management) and these updates aim to boost I/O and network performance for VMs and cloud services.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Generally Available: MSSQL extension integration with GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
Microsoft announced general availability of an integration between the MSSQL extension for Visual Studio Code and GitHub Copilot, bringing AI-powered SQL assistance into the VS Code workflow to reduce repetitive tasks, accelerate development, and assist with database schema design.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Add durability to AI agents in Azure Functions using Microsoft Agent Framework
item.description:
Microsoft has released a public preview that integrates the durable extension for Microsoft Agent Framework with Azure Functions, enabling durable, hosted orchestration for production-grade AI agents.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: AKS Automatic managed system node pools
item.description:
Microsoft announced a public preview for AKS Automatic managed system node pools, a feature that automates provisioning and maintenance (scaling, patching, availability) of AKS system node pools to reduce operational overhead and let teams focus on applications.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Application Gateway for Containers Istio Service Mesh integration
item.description:
Application Gateway for Containers is in public preview for integration with the Istio service mesh via an optional service mesh extension, enabling simplified secure north‚Äìsouth communication between external clients and services inside the mesh.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Container Apps adds support for agentic Docker Compose
item.description:
Azure Container Apps is announcing a public preview that brings Docker Compose support to the service, enabling developers to use their existing docker-compose workflows to define and run multi-container applications directly on Azure Container Apps. This integration aims to simplify deployment and lower the friction for moving compose-based projects to the cloud.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Container Apps introduces flexible workload profile
item.description:
Azure Container Apps launched a Public Preview of a flexible workload profile that combines the simplicity and pay-per-use serverless model of consumption plans with many performance and control characteristics typically found in dedicated workload profiles.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Cosmos DB Fleet Analytics
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB Fleet Analytics is in public preview and provides centralized, large-scale insights across multiple Cosmos DB accounts, subscriptions, and workloads to help manage and analyze data across an organization’s entire Cosmos DB footprint.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Cosmos DB MCP ToolKit for Microsoft Foundry Agent Service
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL now provides an MCP Toolkit for use with the Microsoft Foundry Agent Service, available in public preview; the integration enables Microsoft Foundry Agents to connect directly to data stored in Azure Cosmos DB.

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Database for PostgreSQL ‚Äì Flexible Server pg_duckdb extension

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Object Replication Priority Replication for Azure Blob
item.description:
Azure Blob Object Replication Priority Replication is now generally available, letting customers mark replication policy rules for prioritized copying from a source storage account to a destination storage account so selected objects are replicated ahead of others.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Troubleshoot Azure Firewall using packet capture
item.description:
Azure has announced a Public Preview feature to troubleshoot Azure Firewall using packet capture. The capability captures specific flows with filtering by protocol, flags and other filters, and captures can be started from the Azure portal or via PowerShell.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Claude Sonnet 3.5 deprecated, Claude Haiku 4.5 available in Copilot Free
item.description:
GitHub deprecated Claude Sonnet 3.5 across all Copilot experiences on November 10, 2025, and made Claude Haiku 4.5 available in Copilot Free.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency now supports Visual Studio subscriptions
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency now supports Visual Studio subscriptions, letting organizations use GitHub Enterprise features via Visual Studio subscriptions while keeping data stored in chosen regions for compliance. The support applies to both subscription-based and usage-based (metered) GitHub Enterprise plans.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Application Gateway for Containers with Web Application Firewall (WAF)
item.description:
Azure announces general availability of Web Application Firewall (WAF) support for Application Gateway for Containers, the next evolution of Application Gateway combined with the Application Gateway Ingress Controller.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: ‚Äã‚ÄãSecuring our future: November 2025 progress report on Microsoft‚Äôs Secure Future Initiative ‚Äã‚Äã
item.description:
Microsoft published a November 2025 progress report for its Secure Future Initiative, reporting steady progress across all areas and engineering pillars. The initiative‚Äôs mission is to accelerate innovation, strengthen resilience, and lead the industry toward a safer digital future, with the report underscoring Microsoft‚Äôs continued commitment to security.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: Raptor mini is rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub has begun a public preview rollout of Raptor mini, an experimental model available in GitHub Copilot for Visual Studio Code. The model is being made available to users on Pro, Pro+, and Free plans and can be selected within the Copilot settings. The announcement appeared on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: k8s: Announcing the 2025 Steering Committee Election Results
item.description:
The 2025 Kubernetes Steering Committee election concluded. Four of seven seats were up for election; the incoming members begin two-year terms immediately. The post announces the newly elected members, continuing members, election officers, emeritus members, and gives ways for the community to follow and participate in Steering Committee work.

  • Source: Kubernetes Official Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: openCypher support for KQL graph semantics
item.description:
Microsoft announces public preview of openCypher support for KQL graph semantics, enabling openCypher queries over graph data in Fabric Eventhouse and Azure Data Explorer.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: labels() function in KQL graph semantics
item.description:
The labels() function in KQL graph semantics is now generally available. It lets you retrieve, filter, and project label information for nodes and edges in graph queries, simplifying work with categorized graph data.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Database for PostgreSQL ‚Äì Flexible Server availability zones expansion in Japan West
item.description:
Azure Database for PostgreSQL ‚Äì Flexible Server is now generally available in all three availability zones in Japan West, allowing deployments that improve availability and resiliency.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: ‚Äã‚ÄãWhisper Leak: A novel side-channel attack on remote language models
item.description:
Microsoft disclosed a new side-channel attack called “Whisper Leak” that enables attackers to infer conversation topics from interactions with remote language models even when communications are encrypted. The finding was published on the Microsoft Security Blog.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: Removing notifications for @mentions in commit messages
item.description:
GitHub is removing notifications that come from @mentions inside commit messages to reduce spam and help users focus on important notifications. Previously, mentioning a user or team in a commit message would generate a notification; that behavior is being removed.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Actions pull_request_target and environment branch protections changes
item.description:
GitHub will change how Actions’ pull_request_target and environment branch protection rules are evaluated for pull-request-related events, effective 2025-12-08, to reduce security-critical exposures.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GraphQL Explorer removal from API documentation on November 7, 2025
item.description:
On November 7, 2025 GitHub retired the GraphQL Explorer from its API documentation. The change, following a prior announcement, affects a small number of users who used the Explorer to experiment with the GitHub GraphQL API.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Pull request ‚ÄúFiles changed‚Äù public preview and merge experience ‚Äì November 6 updates
item.description:
GitHub updated the public preview of the new pull request ‘Files changed’ page (Nov 6). Highlights include the ability to apply suggested changes in batch, new options to collapse parts of the page for easier navigation, and improvements to the merge experience.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: New releases for GitHub Actions ‚Äì November 2025
item.description:
GitHub increased limits for reusable workflows in GitHub Actions (November 2025): workflows can now nest up to 10 reusable workflows and a single workflow run can call up to 50 workflows in total.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved onboarding flow for GitHub Projects
item.description:
GitHub updated the Projects onboarding flow to help users start faster by adding options to connect and import items from a repository and to set a default repository for new issues.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Ultra Disk‚Äôs new flexible provisioning model
item.description:
Azure Ultra Disk is now generally available with a new flexible provisioning model that lets you configure capacity, IOPS and throughput (MBPS) more independently so you can better tailor and optimize disk performance for your workloads.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: k8s: Gateway API 1.4: New Features
item.description:
Gateway API v1.4.0 (released Oct 6, 2025) advances Kubernetes service networking with three features promoted to Standard (BackendTLSPolicy, supportedFeatures in GatewayClass status, and named rule fields for Routes) and several experimental additions (Mesh/XMesh, default Gateways, and an ExternalAuth filter for HTTPRoute). The release also adds per-port TLS/client-certificate configuration to address connection coalescing security, introduces a couple of breaking validation changes, improves CI/docs, and is usable on Kubernetes >=1.26.

  • Source: Kubernetes Official Blog

item.title: security: New IDC research highlights a major cloud security shift
item.description:
IDC research urges CISOs to adopt AI-powered, integrated cloud security platforms‚Äîsuch as CNAPP, XDR, and SIEM‚Äîto lower risk, reduce complexity, and improve resilience, according to a Microsoft Security Blog post.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Object Replication Metrics
item.description:
Azure Blob Storage object replication metrics for pending operations and pending bytes are now generally available in all regions, enabling customers to monitor replication status and act on delays.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Database for PostgreSQL read replicas with Premium SSD v2
item.description:
Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server now supports configuring read replicas (in-region and geo-replicas) with the Premium SSD v2 storage tier in Public Preview, enabling scale-out for read-heavy workloads and improved performance by offloading read operations.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for early November 2025
item.description:
In early November 2025 Azure announced a Public Preview update for Azure SQL Hyperscale that adds support for multiple geo‚Äësecondary replicas. This capability simplifies designing and deploying disaster recovery topologies that span multiple regions.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: GitHub Copilot in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)
item.description:
GitHub Copilot for SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) is available in public preview. It provides context-aware assistance to help you write Transact-SQL (T-SQL) faster and more accurately and can answer general SQL questions using database and connection context.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure MCP Server
item.description:
Azure MCP Server is now generally available. Built on the Model Context Protocol (MCP), it provides a secure, standards-based bridge that lets agent-based applications and developer workflows access and coordinate across Azure services (examples called out include AKS, ACA, App Service, Cosmos DB, SQL, and AI Foundry). The GA release is aimed at simplifying integration, improving security and interoperability, and enabling cloud-powered agents.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: vscode: Open Source AI Editor: Second Milestone
item.description:
Ghost text suggestions have been open sourced as part of the Copilot Chat extension ‚Äî the second milestone toward making VS Code an open source AI editor.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Planned Failover for Azure Storage
item.description:
Planned Failover for Azure Storage is now generally available. It lets customers initiate a managed failover for geo-redundant storage accounts, swapping primary and secondary endpoints while preserving geo-redundancy and data durability.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: The legacy Copilot usage report CSV is no longer available
item.description:
GitHub has retired the legacy Copilot usage report CSV that organization administrators could access under Copilot access settings; the report was deprecated three months earlier and is now no longer available.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: enterprise: qualifier is now generally available in GitHub code search
item.description:
GitHub code search now includes a new enterprise: qualifier (generally available) that lets you search across all organizations in your enterprise, simplifying searches that previously required manually combining multiple organizations.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent supports organization custom instructions
item.description:
GitHub announced that the Copilot coding agent ‚Äî its asynchronous, autonomous background agent ‚Äî now supports organization-level custom instructions to guide how Copilot understands and works with projects.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent now supports pull request templates
item.description:
GitHub‚Äôs Copilot coding agent, an autonomous background agent that creates and updates pull requests with a summary of its changes, now supports repository pull request templates so its generated PR bodies follow your repo‚Äôs template while still inserting the agent‚Äôs summary.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: How Copilot Studio uses .NET and WebAssembly for performance and innovation
item.description:
Microsoft explains how Copilot Studio uses .NET to run AI agents consistently across platforms and to bring performant, innovative agent execution to the web via WebAssembly.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Database for MySQL ‚Äì Flexible Server now supports high availability with dedicated Azure Standard Load Balancer
item.description:
Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server now generally availability (GA) supports a dedicated Azure Standard Load Balancer for servers configured with high availability, delivering a dedicated load-balancing option for HA-enabled deployments.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: ExpressRoute resiliency insights
item.description:
Azure has announced general availability of Resiliency Insights for ExpressRoute. This assessment capability measures network reliability for ExpressRoute workloads using a resiliency index ‚Äî a percentage score calculated from factors such as route resilience (source content truncated).

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Monitor end-to-end ExpressRoute connectivity with Connection Monitor
item.description:
Azure has made Connection Monitor integration generally available for ExpressRoute, allowing end-to-end connectivity monitoring to be enabled directly when creating or updating ExpressRoute connections.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: ORDER BY ST_DISTANCE in Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL Geospatial Queries
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL now generally supports ORDER BY ST_DISTANCE, allowing queries to be sorted by distance from a point or GeoJSON object directly in the database.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Query Advisor in Azure Cosmos DB
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL now offers Query Advisor as generally available in the .NET SDK. Query Advisor analyzes your query structure and gives clear, actionable recommendations to help you write faster, more efficient queries.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: ‚Äã‚ÄãSecuring critical infrastructure: Why Europe‚Äôs risk-based regulations matter
item.description:
The article explains how new European Union risk-based legislation helps CISOs strengthen cybersecurity for critical infrastructure by encouraging organizations to assess and prioritize risks, align controls with regulatory expectations, and build more resilient systems.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: ExpressRoute resiliency validation
item.description:
Azure has made ExpressRoute Resiliency Validation generally available. The feature lets you perform site failovers for your Virtual Network Gateway to assess and validate network connectivity resiliency for ExpressRoute-enabled workloads.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Open Source: Announcing the DocumentDB Kubernetes Operator
item.description:
Microsoft announced the open-source DocumentDB Kubernetes Operator, which lets you run DocumentDB (a MongoDB‚Äëcompatible, open-source document database built on PostgreSQL) on Kubernetes by extending the cluster with custom resource definitions (CRDs).

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: npm security update: Classic token creation disabled and granular token changes
item.description:
GitHub announced an npm security update that disables creation of classic tokens and introduces the first changes toward a granular token management system to strengthen npm security.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: A Unified Experience for all Coding Agents
item.description:
The article announces that coding agents have become central to VS Code in 2025, describing new agent mode, Copilot integration, and the GitHub Copilot CLI while noting the growing ecosystem of agents from providers like OpenAI and Anthropic.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Secret scanning detects Base64-encoded secrets and more ‚Äî October 2025
item.description:
GitHub announced October 2025 updates to its secret scanning service, including new detection for Base64-encoded secrets and other expanded support for additional secret types.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Get Ready for .NET Conf 2025!
item.description:
Announcement: .NET Conf 2025 is scheduled for November 11‚Äì13, featuring .NET 10 and Visual Studio 2026, with a Student Zone on November 14.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot policy update for unconfigured policies
item.description:
GitHub fixed an issue that sometimes caused organization-level Copilot policies to display incorrect options when the enterprise-level policy was set to ‚ÄúUnconfigured.‚Äù The change ensures organizations now see the correct Copilot policy options in that scenario.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: ‚Äã‚ÄãLearn what generative AI can do for your security operations center
item.description:
Microsoft Security Blog published an e-book that shows how generative AI can improve Security Operations Centers (SOCs) by reducing alert fatigue, speeding triage, enabling proactive threat hunting, and helping teams get ahead of cyberattacks.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: Required review by specific teams now available in rulesets
item.description:
GitHub now lets repository administrators require approvals from specific teams to merge changes into protected branches using rulesets. You can target these team-based approval requirements to particular files and folders, giving finer-grained control over who must sign off on changes.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Delegate AI controls management to members of your enterprise
item.description:
GitHub now lets enterprise owners delegate management of AI and Copilot policies and setup administration to specific enterprise members and teams, without requiring broad enterprise ownership.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Manage budgets and track usage with new billing API updates
item.description:
GitHub expanded its billing APIs to let organizations programmatically manage budgets, track usage, and retrieve cost center data so finance and engineering teams can automate cost controls and reporting.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot policy now supports agent mode in the IDE
item.description:
GitHub admins can now control access to Copilot‚Äôs agent mode in IDEs through the Copilot policies page on github.com. The change is intended to give organizations better governance over who can use agent mode in development environments.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files Object REST API
item.description:
Azure NetApp Files is offering a Public Preview of an Object REST API ‚Äî an S3-compatible REST API that lets customers bridge traditional file-based storage and modern cloud services, enabling reuse of existing data and integration with Microsoft Fabric.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: SesameOp: Novel backdoor uses OpenAI Assistants API for command and control
item.description:
Microsoft DART researchers identified a novel backdoor, dubbed SesameOp, that abuses the OpenAI Assistants API as a covert command-and-control (C2) channel. A component of the backdoor uses the Assistants API as a storage/relay to fetch commands and execute tasks inside compromised environments, avoiding traditional C2 methods.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: Control AI spending with budget tracking for GitHub AI tools
item.description:
GitHub announced budget-tracking controls for AI tools and the launch of two new premium request SKUs for the GitHub Copilot coding agent and GitHub Spark to help teams manage AI spending as usage grows.

  • Source: GitHub
